nodes.bodyText:
The issue is just that we do not want to force it from Realm, but I guess it should be OK to have test apps using it?
If you really want to keep test apps pre-AndroidX, we could consider adding the AndroidX as an api dependency in Realm until eliminated again. This way dependent projects where we added did not need the explicit dependency and would fail when we removed it again. This way we would not forget to remove it again.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,2 @@
+# FIXME: Required as long as we depend on PlayServices for RemoteMongDB API's
+android.useAndroidX=true

nodes.bodyText:
Since the rest of the Android ecosystem have more or less moved to AndroidX since it is a requirement for a lot of Google libraries, I think we should probably migrate all of our examples to that as well. Maybe besides one, just to make sure we don't depend on it.
But we should do that in another PR
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,2 @@
+# FIXME: Required as long as we depend on PlayServices for RemoteMongDB API's
+android.useAndroidX=true
